intro: Critesion glaucum, commonly known as the bluebells, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is characterized by its clusters of bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in moist, wooded areas and has lance-shaped leaves with a bluish-green hue. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is known for its ornamental value in gardens. The plant's bulbs are also used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits.
